website_summaries.verdict: For those beard owners who seek a balm that is closer to an oil, this is definitely one to consider. Also works well as a skin conditioner and regular hair styling product.
pros: Proprietary blend of numerous natural oils and butters
Citrus and rosemary fragrance is not overwhelming
cons: Fragrance often compared to Vick's Vapor Rub or bug repellent
Hold does not last all day, develops waxy texture

customer_reviews.title: Softer, more manageable beard, residue is annoying.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff makes your beard softer, and wrangles loose hairs and flyers back onto your face --generally makes my beard look more groomed. It does however, leave greasy residue on your beard, and hands after touching it. It is a leave in conditioner so this isn't a knock on the product just something to be aware of. Also,the grease also gets on clothes; shirt collars and there is some build up around my suit pans pockets, as well as the places around the waist I use to hoist my pants but again something to be aware of. Overall good stuff, I'll be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: Great balm. This is a really good compromise between ...

This straddles that line about as well as any I've found. I have a very wiry beard, so the hold is needed. For the same reasons, moisturizing is needed as well. This does a good job with a scent that is pleasant but not overwhelming.
